page.title: 19HISTORIC HOUSE
page.content: {MOLESWORTH MANOR,LITTLE PETHERICK. The present local stone and Delabole slate eighteenth century Manor house was built by Sir Henry Hugh Molesworth on the site of an earlier Elizabethen house.The newest part of the house is the west wing completed in 1854.Sir Henry's son-in-law Ashington Riley left the estate to the church.The present owner is Mrs Pearce who bought the house fifteen years ago and now lives there with her daughter and two sons. The three storey building has some thirty rooms which include a playroom, nursery, billiard room, 2 kitchens and up to 12 bedrooms.Some walls are covered by the original Morris wallpaper.Mrs Pearce has redecorated other rooms using dark reds and greens which are in keeping with the original decor.
